definitions.title: n.pr.loc.
definitions.body: of valley S. of Jerusalem, (LXX fa/ragga )Onom Jos 15:8, Jos 15:8 Sonnam Jos 18:16; Taienna v:Jos 18:16; Taibenqom 2Ch 28:3, LXXL fa/r. Benennom; ge\ bane\ (Ennom) 2Ch 33:6, LXXL gn= Benennom; elsewh. usu. fa/r. (ni(ou=) (Ennom)—cf. sub [[גַּיְא]];—as mere topographical term [[גֵּי בֶן־הִנּׁם]], boundary between Judah & Benjamin Jos 15:8, Jos 18:16; also ´[[גֵּי ה]] Jos 15:8, Jos 18:16 (all P) cf. Ne 11:30; elsewhere alw. ´[[בֶן־ה]] ´[[גּ]] (2Ki 23:10 Kt has [[הנם גי בני]], Qr & LXX Vulgate sing.), & alw. with ref. to the sacrifice of children by fire, 2Ki 23:10, 2Ch 28:3, 2Ch 33:6, Je 7:31, Je 7:32, Je 19:2, Je 19:6, Je 32:35; on account of this inhuman & idolatrous practice it was abhorred by priest & prophet, & defiled by Josiah; this conception afterward developed, through Is 66:24, into Jewish Gehinnom (cf. Weber:Synagog. Theol. 326 ff. Di:Buch Henoch. 131 f.) & NT ge/enna. On locality cf. Rob:BR ii. 273 f. Tobler:Topogr. ii 39 ff. Bd:Pal 103; mod. name (of lower half of valley, toward SE.) Wady er-Rabâbi.
